question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_consensus_db()] [Timeout Certificate Forgery] Does exposing highest_tc structure at line 137 reveal the timeout certificate format and validator signatures sufficiently to allow Byzantine validators to forge fake timeout certificates that force unnecessary round changes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_consensus_db()] [Round Prediction Attack] Can the complete block history with rounds at line 145 enable attackers to predict future round assignments and leader elections, allowing them to launch targeted censorship attacks against specific upcoming leaders? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_consensus_db()] [Parent Chain Analysis] Does exposing block.parent_id() at line 146 allow attackers to reconstruct the complete DAG structure and identify vulnerable fork points where consensus safety could be violated with < 1/3 Byzantine validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks()] [Payload Inspection for MEV] Can dumping block payloads at line 148 before they're committed expose pending transactions to MEV bots that can front-run or sandwich attacks based on this advance knowledge? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_consensus_db()] [QC Signature Analysis] Does exposing QC signatures at line 153 provide sufficient information to analyze which validators are online and participating, enabling targeted eclipse attacks against minority validator subsets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks()] [Timestamp Manipulation Detection] Can exposing block.timestamp_usecs() at line 147 reveal timestamp manipulation by Byzantine validators, but also expose the timing patterns of honest validators for clock synchronization attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_block_request()] [Database Query Timing] Can measuring the response time of queries with specific block_ids at line 192 leak information about database indexing structure, allowing attackers to infer which blocks are 'hot' in cache vs cold in disk? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_quorum_store_db()] [Batch Existence Timing] Does get_batch() at line 168 have different timing when a batch exists vs doesn't exist, creating a timing oracle that reveals which digests are valid without requiring full database access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks()] [Iteration Timing Attack] Can the time taken for the block iteration at lines 190-204 reveal the number of blocks in the database, helping attackers estimate consensus progress and predict future state roots? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks_bcs()] [Serialization Timing] Does bcs::to_bytes() at line 239 have timing variations based on transaction complexity that leak information about transaction types before they're publicly committed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Content-Length Mismatch] Can the CONTENT_LENGTH header set at line 27 be incorrect if body.len() doesn't match actual serialized size, causing HTTP protocol violations or client parsing errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_quorum_store_db_request()] [Header Injection] Does setting HeaderValue::from(result.len()) at line 61 validate that result.len() doesn't overflow header size limits, potentially causing HTTP response splitting or smuggling attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_block_request()] [Query String Parsing] Can specially crafted query strings at line 79 with duplicate parameters or encoding tricks bypass the form_urlencoded::parse() logic and inject unexpected values into query_pairs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_quorum_store_db_request()] [URI Length Attack] Is there validation on req.uri().query() length at line 44 before parsing, or can attackers send extremely long query strings that cause parser DoS or buffer overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Response Body Size] Can dumping the entire consensus database create response bodies exceeding HTTP protocol limits, causing the response to be truncated and corrupted mid-transfer? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Blocking Task Starvation] Can spawn_blocking at line 23 exhaust the blocking thread pool if multiple concurrent dump requests are made, preventing other critical blocking operations like disk I/O for consensus from executing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_quorum_store_db_request()] [Async Task Cancellation] If the HTTP request is cancelled while spawn_blocking is executing at line 57, does the blocking task properly detect cancellation, or does it continue consuming resources reading the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_block_request()] [Nested Blocking Calls] Can the spawn_blocking closure at line 106 make additional blocking calls (like database locks), causing deadlocks if the blocking thread pool is exhausted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Await Without Timeout] Does the .await at line 23 have a timeout, or can slow database operations cause the HTTP handler to hang indefinitely, exhausting available async tasks and preventing new requests from being processed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks()] [Inconsistent Block-Batch Mapping] Can extract_txns_from_block() at line 194 return transactions that don't actually belong to the specified block if all_batches contains stale or corrupted batch data, causing audit trails to be unreliable? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks_bcs()] [Transaction Order Violation] Does the Vec<Transaction> constructed at line 226-232 preserve the original transaction order from blocks, or can the iteration order be non-deterministic causing replays to produce different state roots? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_consensus_db()] [Block-QC Mismatch] Can the blocks and QCs dumped at lines 139-154 be inconsistent where a block references a QC that isn't included in the dump, making the exported data unusable for consensus replay or auditing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_quorum_store_db()] [Batch Digest Collision] If two batches hash to the same digest value, does get_all_batches() at line 171 return both batches or only one, potentially causing transaction loss in dumps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: dump_blocks()] [Empty Body Ambiguity] Does the empty body case at line 206-211 distinguish between 'no blocks exist' vs 'block_id not found', creating ambiguity that could hide database corruption or consensus failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/consensus/mod.rs] [Function: handle_dump_consensus_db_request()] [Logging Information Disclosure] Do the info! log statements at lines 21, 25, 31 log request parameters or response sizes that could leak information about consensus state to log monitoring systems or unauthorized log viewers? (Medium)
